questionText: What is the purpose of the `token::flush` function in the context of a `TokenPolicy`?

answerOptions.answerText: It resets all rules applied to the `TokenPolicy`.
It consumes spent balance from the `TokenPolicy` using the `TreasuryCap`.
It enables a previously disallowed action in the `TokenPolicy`.
It confirms a pending `ActionRequest` in the `TokenPolicy`.

questionText: Which function allows adding custom conditions (rules) to specific actions in a `TokenPolicy`?

answerOptions.answerText: `token::allow` enables adding custom rules to token actions.
`token::confirm_request` is used for adding custom conditions to actions.
`token::add_rule_for_action` allows developers to specify custom rules for actions.
`token::flush` is responsible for adding rules to actions in the `TokenPolicy`.
